question: The main memory accommodates ____________
options: ['a) operating system', 'b) cpu', 'c) user processes', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: What is the operating system?
options: ['a) in the low memory', 'b) in the high memory', 'c) either low or high memory (depending on the location of interrupt vector)', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) either low or high memory (depending on the location of interrupt vector)

question: In contiguous memory allocation ____________
options: ['a) each process is contained in a single contiguous section of memory', 'b) all processes are contained in a single contiguous section of memory', 'c) the memory space is contiguous', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) each process is contained in a single contiguous section of memory
option2: b) all processes are contained in a single contiguous section of memory
option3: c) the memory space is contiguous

question: The relocation register helps in ____________
options: ['a) providing more address space to processes', 'b) a different address space to processes', 'c) to protect the address spaces of processes', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) providing more address space to processes
option2: b) a different address space to processes
option3: c) to protect the address spaces of processes

question: With relocation and limit registers, each logical address must be _______ the limit register
options: ['a) less than', 'b) equal to', 'c) greater than', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The operating system and the other processes are protected from being modified by an already running process because ____________
options: ['a) they are in different memory spaces', 'b) they are in different logical addresses', 'c) they have a protection algorithm', 'd) every address generated by the CPU is being checked against the relocation and limit registers']
option1: a) they are in different memory spaces
option2: b) they are in different logical addresses
option3: c) they have a protection algorithm
option4: d) every address generated by the CPU is being checked against the relocation and limit registers

question: Transient operating system code is code that ____________
options: ['a) is not easily accessible', 'b) comes and goes as needed', 'c) stays in the memory always', 'd) never enters the memory space']
option2: b) comes and goes as needed
option3: c) stays in the memory always
option4: d) never enters the memory space

question: Using transient code, _______ the size of the operating system during program execution
When memory is divided into several fixed sized partitions, each partition may contain ________
options: ['a) exactly one process', 'b) at least one process', 'c) multiple processes at once', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: In fixed size partition, the degree of multiprogramming is bounded by ___________
options: ['a) the number of partitions', 'b) the CPU utilization', 'c) the memory size', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: The first fit, best fit and worst fit are strategies to select a ______
options: ['a) process from a queue to put in memory', 'b) processor to run the next process', 'c) free hole from a set of available holes', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) process from a queue to put in memory
option2: b) processor to run the next process
option3: c) free hole from a set of available holes
